abstract: Google reports first-quarter net income of $3.6 billion, or $5.20 a share, compared with $2.5 billion, or $5.04 a share in year-earlier period; reports revenue of $17.3 billion, up 12 percent from previous quarter; results fall short of analyst expectations, amid continuing concern about slowing growth at company.
lead_paragraph: The search giant’s first-quarter net revenue was $13.9 billion, from $12.2 billion, but analysts had expected $14.04 billion.

headline.main: At $17.3 Billion, Google’s Quarterly Revenue Rose 12 Percent
headline.print_headline: Google’s Quarterly Revenue Rises, but Analysts Still Fret About Growth

snippet: The search giant’s first-quarter net revenue was $13.9 billion, from $12.2 billion, but analysts had expected $14.04 billion.
